intro: Ouratea luschnathiana, commonly known as the white-flowered ouratea, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Caribbean and Central America. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and thrives in humid, well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and as a houseplant. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds.
